Subject: [sfraves] Dinosaurs rule the dancefloors no more

--=====================_51273671==.ALT
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

The Year the Superstar Dj Died


WEB EXCLUSIVE!: Dinosaurs rule the dancefloors no more
By JEAN CAREY

Thursday, December 28, 2006 - 2:01 pm


For nearly a decade, the giants of electronic dance music, a cold-blooded cadre mostly from northern Europe, lumbered across the earth. Tiesto, Paul van Dyk, Paul Oakenfold, Seb Fontaine, Judge Jules and Fatboy Slim dominated small suburban dancefloors and Ibizan caverns alike with crafty disco assembled from chest-rattling basslines and sampled treasures from earlier civilizations.

Suddenly, in 2006, like dinosaurs shuddering in the freezing contrail of a passing comet, the time of the superstar DJs ended. Today, the big boys are gasping for space as overpaid nightclub hosts, while small, furry mammals named Busdriver, Ellen Alien, and Otto Von Schirach have sprung forth to occupy their musical niche in the ecosystem.

The sad thing—one of the sad things—about the superstar DJs' looming extinction is that they didn't begin with Brontosaurus brains. IDM, or "intelligent dance music," is the obviously and deliberately limiting terminology for electronica that isn't stupid. The expression dates back to a description of Coil's 1991 album The Snow, which set the IQ bar pretty high, and the artists who followed in the last decade of the century--the Orb, Autechre, Future Sound of London--kept apace.

By 2000, European electronic dance music evolved into dozens of microgenres from the various species of house music, techno and EBM. Pioneering DJs such as Oakenfold and Fatboy Slim found they could press their popular discs and also attract respectable concert attendance numbers through careful marketing of their riveting live sets, which blended their own compositions with remixes of other artists' tracks. Meanwhile, in the States, dance music factions were essentially limited to house and trance, a situation that continues today.

And why shouldn't it? Americans almost always muck up the nuance in the cultures we import, and dance music has proven no exception. While European DJs cultivated a humbly anonymous aesthetic, Americans reinvented the DJ as turntable-toting rock star. Thus today we enjoy the Crystal Method's relentless efforts to brand their faces on such maximum party records as the cleverly named Tweekend and Legion of Boom, and this year, both the Crystal Method and taggers-along LCD Soundsystem produced 45-minute "workout mixes" in association with Nike.

But it is now clear that the DJ craze is on the wane in the U.S. The huge throngs that once welcomed Van Dyk, Carl Cox and the ubiquitous Oakenfold have dried up, at least in the smaller major cities. Once people in places like Dallas and Atlanta figured out the headliner would show up at 3 a.m., play a 20-minute set and split, it was all over, and from then on, guys like that were forced to retreat to hosting superclubs in tried-and-true markets in Miami, New York and San Francisco.

CONTINUED:  http://www.ocweekly.com/features/year-in-review/the-year-the-superstar-dj-died/26472/






http://www.asambleapopulardeoaxaca.com/ 

MySpace:  http://www.myspace.com/DJApollo 

Tribenet:   <http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k>http://people.tribe.net/djapollo2k 
                
House Music 101:  http://livingart.com/raving/articles/housemusic101.htm

"An adult is one who has lost the grace, the freshness, the innocence of the child, who is no longer capable of feeling pure joy, who makes everything complicated, who spreads suffering everywhere, who is afraid of being happy, and who, because it is easier to bear, has gone back to sleep.  The wise man is a happy child."
-Arnaud Desjardins

"Music rots when it gets too far from the dance.  Poetry atrophies when it gets too far from the music."
-Ezra Pound  
--=====================_51273671==.ALT--

Message-ID: <45998993.9070202@defsf.com>
Date: Mon, 01 Jan 2007 14:22:11 -0800
From: Sean Ocean <seanocean@defsf.com>
User-Agent: Thunderbird 1.5.0.7 (Windows/20060909)

To:  sfraves@hyperreal.org

Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: [sfraves] you down wit KFJC? (yeh you know mee!)

having not even a tape deck in my truck and only AM/FM radio has allowed 
me to appreciate the finer things in life.. such as the national weather 
service computer vocoded radio broadcasts on am radio, which i find very 
cathartic and meditative, to awesome consistently avant garde Foothills 
Junior College broadcasts at FM 89.7. i mean, like i've been listening 
in the last few months for any waivering in weirdness and so far KFJC 
makes KALX 90.7 look like top 40 radio. i've never heard so much tuvan 
throat singing! `;) on any given moment there could be grindcore, idm, 
freejazz, to turntablism in the same hour.

if you're already familiar with this station, you can call me a newbie 
but i just love this station. if you haven't heard this station put an 
ear out or a really big antenna and tune in. 89.7 has renewed my hope 
for radio in general. if you're lazy scope the 
netcast..http://www.kfjc.org/netcast/index.php but i personally think 
the static adds a more homey feel to the station. `;)

hey while i'm at it, big ups 2 my man down there in KZSU for still 
making it happen.. anyone catch the solstice marathon?

respex to all.
sean ocean
dj disconnect
http://www.defsf.com

Subject: [sfraves] BSP - Fukwerk Fridays - New techno happy hour

Hi, I'll be playing jacking techno at a new happy hour this friday at  
111 Minna. Here's the info and a link to a mix of mine:

http://www.uploadmix.com/Solekandi/james%20bass%20techno%20grooves.mp3

Each and every Friday, starting Jan. 5, 2007 from 5:00 till we stop

Get SF's newest weekly happy hour started right!

Join us Friday, Jan. 5 for the launch of Fukwerk Fridays at the much
beloved 111 Minna, your first stop out of the Financial District.

Avoid cover and head straight for the Zappa Room and enjoy $1 off
beer, wine and well cocktails.

Bassaholics Anonymous resident ::james bass:: joins your hosts ::jenn
and yanni solekandi:. for an early evening of maximum beats for
minimal damage.

Be there, or be the boss!

Fukwerk Fridays is hosted by solekandi (bay area beatdr_p) and
features a rotating lineup of weekly guests, including

Nova (Routes, Beyond Jazz)
Razvan (East Bay Minimal Techno Collective)
Kawa (Peoplemuver)
James Bass (Bassaholics Anonymous)

http://www.babd.org/
http://www.myspace.com/fukwerkfridays

Subject: [sfraves] Rocking New Year's Eve From The Land of The Rising Boobies Totally not work safe

Forget Janet Jackson.

This is how they do it, "Wardrobe Malfunction" Stylee on *live* National
TV in Japan on New Year's Eve, 2007:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k4hYsmIZtGc&eurl=

won't be sorry.

of Woody Allen's line from Annie Hall about how he'd like to do to his
date "what Eisenhower had been doing to the country for the last 8 years":

The Edward R. Murrow, serve the public interest thing in bringing the
American Public the unbiased news out of a sense of civic duty from
the Big 3 TV Networks died in 1977 when Roone Arledge took ABC News
and began to run it for profit.

Since then, the only reason that TV News exists, (and that's
*everything* you see to include CNN, MSNBC, and of course FUX, as well
as CBS, NBC and ABC) is to:

Sell advertising.

Especially bottled water, flouridated, or otherwise, since it sells
for 4 times the price of gasoline, at $10 a gallon.

Gotta make it look sexy so people will forget just how much they're
paying for it.

That's it.

~nyc

I'd Rather Be Matin' Than Hatin'  ~ Me

"Now, 75 years later in an abundant society where people have
laptops,cellphones, iPods and minds like empty rooms, I still plod
along with books." ~ Harper Lee, 2006

"There aren't a lot of things in this world that one can be sure of,
but I do know this; anytime you go by a House of Worship, of any size,
and of any denomination, that's filled to its rafters with people, you
can be certain that the vast majority of those people haven't actually
taken the time out to read The Bible, or whatever ancient, "Sacred
Text" that they subscribe to,because if they had read it, that House
of Worship would be nearly empty."
~Nyc Alberts, NYC, October, 2006

On 1 January 2007, Sean Ocean wrote:

> having not even a tape deck in my truck and only AM/FM radio has allowed me 
> to appreciate the finer things in life.. such as the national weather service 
> computer vocoded radio broadcasts on am radio, which i find very cathartic 
> and meditative, to awesome consistently avant garde Foothills Junior College 
> broadcasts at FM 89.7. i mean, like i've been listening in the last few 
> months for any waivering in weirdness and so far KFJC makes KALX 90.7 look 
> like top 40 radio. i've never heard so much tuvan throat singing! `;) on any 
> given moment there could be grindcore, idm, freejazz, to turntablism in the 
> same hour.
>
> if you're already familiar with this station, you can call me a newbie but i 
> just love this station. if you haven't heard this station put an ear out or a 
> really big antenna and tune in. 89.7 has renewed my hope for radio in 
> general. if you're lazy scope the 
> netcast..http://www.kfjc.org/netcast/index.php but i personally think the 
> static adds a more homey feel to the station. `;)
>
> hey while i'm at it, big ups 2 my man down there in KZSU for still making it 
> happen.. anyone catch the solstice marathon?

Thanks for the plug!  (And I'll definitely get a copy of that recording 
to you.  MP3 organization hasn't been my strong suit.)  KFJC is 
generally a great station in my mind, if only sometimes a bit TOO 
narrowminded.

Which brings up another special we're going to be airing at KZSU. 
You see, KZSU is rapidly approaching its 60th Anniversary on January 6, 
2007. To celebrate we're having a 60 hour marathon, an hour for every 
year we've been on the air.

That's right, starting with 1947 at noon on January 4th and running 
through 2006 ending at 11:59pm on January 6th we're going to broadcast 
an hour for every year we've been on the air.  (I'll be airing 1985, and 
what I've rounded up has me REALLY excited.  Jacki-O is following my 
with 1986, so it could be out of control.)

I do hope you all tune in!

And I can't forget that I hope you all have a fantastic '07!  (Seems 
ominous that we all should, no??)



http://www.jcthedj.com/Support.JC.php
http://kzsu.stanford.edu/~dougm/Reinvent.Your.World.php

Subject: [sfraves] My NYE review :)  What's yours?

So I took BART into the City & rode by this group of people in my train
well... ok... so this couple....Hello 2day.. there were sooooooooooooooo
fuckin' rollin!!  I mean.. they were like grabbing each other Heellla
tight on the legs & i think i saw some boobage grabbing.. & I laughed out
load when i saw them doin' this & I gave them a blue berry candy cane..
they wre actually CooL :)

OK.. so I met up w/ Greg (GBA), his GF, Leslie, ummmm... her Homegirl, oh
gosh, Michael (not Sticky), & ooh.. can't remember names right now... but
we all hooked up @ Greg's GF's & Girl who name i can't rmember's Flat in
this cute alleyway neighborhood in the City.. so that was where the pre
pre party was :)  LoL.. after things get sorted, i think I'll have
something to show y'all :)  But yeah.. we kinda ate, drank, lala la.. had
fun!

Then a friend of the people across the alleyway street  (his name is
Michael too) invited to go hang out at their party... so we did!!!  LoL..
It was fun.. I mean.. I met the people that live there.. & azll their
name's started w/ J.. LoL... & it was a small thing, like 12 people... &
they had cheese, crackers, chips, wine, & weed!  So that was fun like pre
party thing & meeting like these really CooL people :)  Oh yeah... 1 of
them was a person who i met @ Danny's house warming shindig, so that was
kinda Dope bumping into him (Danny... i need to show you his picture
'cause i can't remember who that was!)

Then we all went to El Ricon for the Jungle Code party... it was Dope!! 
Like Dylan & Robyn were the headliners.. ooooooooh Wow... they were
siiiiiiiiiiiiiiick!!  Oh My gosh... they threw down this hard ass Jungle..
really Evil yummy stuff... Robyn even like dropped some Wicked Ass
Hardcore in the middle of the set, & that just made my night to get some
HARDCORE!!!  BUt like i guess when their set wwas about to end... i went
to SOMarts for the Revolution/ Tantra shindig!

OK.. that was fun!!  I kinda had my reservations before nye about going
there 'cause like I dunno... I went there like 3-4 times in 2006 & didn't
feel all too much like going again... but well.. I went & I don't regret
it at all :)  I mean... I also was there to help 'cause they needed people
to crew.. so i kinda did that too :n)  LIke it was funny.. LoL.. right
when i started my water bar/ chai tea shift.. LoL.. DDR came over & was
all "Hey.. I know you!  Gimme some water!"  LoL.. so I hella laughed & we
talked about everything & caught up on everything since we last kicked it,
oh shit... @ TELIC 2 years ago.. but it was Groovy:)  Ooooooooh yeah..
when i got there.. he was performing, doin' this YUMMY ACID TECHNO live PA
dealie & oooh... I could not stop dancing!!  Good Fuckin Shit man!  Hello
2day.. so needed that!  I do feel bad for missing Ethan's set & a few
other sets though.. oh well :\

The Ambiant Mafia tent... Sooooooooo Dope!!!  Wow man.. Lol... Loved it,
Loved the DJs sets.. & yeah.. so Dope! :)  Love U Mafia!!

I was barely in the psy trance room.. lol... but the music in there was
pretty yummy too!! :)

It was perfect @ SOMarts!  I'm soooooooooooooo GLAD i w3as there!!!  It
was Awesome to start the new year w/ Family & yeah... it was just Dope!! 
So glad i was there!

After me & Delia were done w/ our clean up shifts, we took this Awesome
ride to the East Bay on BART talking & catching up & night capping :) 
Well.. BART capping?  Yeah.. & it was Dope... rode w/ her to Richmond &
waited 'til she got on her train to Sac :)  Love U Katya!

Hope y'all had a good time too :)  Here's to a new year of beats, bass, &
Love!

Take Care <3
Peace=->Jus' Me =-> O§bY {8O)

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) 2006:  The Year America Died

http://infowars.net/articles/january2007/020107Year.htm

2006: The Year America Died
Our Commentary on the year past and the year ahead

Steve Watson & Alex Jones
http://Infowars.net
Tuesday, January 2, 2007

2006 was the year that the United States died. Over the course of a  
year, just a few seconds in the span of a country, it's civilization  
and their way of life, we have witnessed the premature death of  
America. The underpinnings, the basic canons and the tenets of the  
United States, as well as it's physical borders, are gone.

But they can be brought back.

The problem is denial. You cannot put something right until you  
identify it as a wrong. The New World Order has won a major victory,  
but because the country is made up of living tissue, each and every  
one of us out there, every man woman and child, it can rise from the  
dead. We can revive the country by passing electricity through its  
heart.

Until recently Europe was deep in the EU but as the final steps were  
being implemented, the people pulled back and voted down EU expansion  
in every country. The same has happened in South America. So we do  
see whole regions, countries and areas rising from the dead in this  
sense.

The good name of America has been used for global corporate empire  
and the country has been turned from the most loved around the world  
into the most hated and despised.

2006 was the year that implementation of the American Union began.  
According to the Council on Foreign Relations, the merger is on track  
or ahead of schedule.

The open plan to merge the US with Mexico and Canada and create a Pan  
American Union has long been a Globalist brainchild but its very real  
and prescient implementation on behalf of the Council on Foreign  
Relations has finally been reported on by mainstream news outlets.

The framework on which the American Union is being pegged is the  
NAFTA Super Highway, a four football-fields-wide leviathan that  
stretches from southern Mexico through the US up to Montreal Canada.  
Coupled with Bush's blanket amnesty program, which the Democrats in  
congress are set to approve this week as their first order of  
business, the Pan American Union is the final jigsaw piece for the  
total dismantling of America as we know it.

------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
---------------------------------------
Get 5 months free at Prison Planet.tv when you sign up for our New  
Year Special! TV shows,
conference footage, field reports, protest clips, in studio camera  
and audio interviews, books,
every Alex Jones film, dozens of other documentaries! Click here to  
subscribe!
------------------------------------------------------------------------ 
---------------------------------------

Social Security, roads, military, intelligence gathering,  
regulations, federal agencies - all within the US, Canada and Mexico  
are being merged into one system at the cost of national sovereignty  
and the common law. What we were is being replaced with the new - no  
liberty, no due process, no freedom, no families, forced drugging, no  
jobs of any significance, no control of your own destiny - in short,  
total control of our lives.

They are not just in name merging the agencies and the laws and the  
regulations, they are physically getting rid of the borders by buying  
off and lobbying the politicians at the state level, who then hand  
the roads over to international bodies and their subsidiary companies.

The armed forces has also seen an influx of foreign troops, an  
average of 20% of ground troops in Iraq are now non citizens, this is  
set to rise to 50% over the next year with foreign recruitment  
stations facilitating the supply.

Think about this, non-US citizens wearing the uniform of American  
soldiers. These troops would be more likely to fire on US citizens  
and follow orders. Every empire, when it represses its own people,  
brings in foreign troops to do the job. Urban warfare drills we have  
covered over the years show that the military is being prepared for  
this.

2007 will be the year of the American Union's fruition. Will the  
people stand up to it and protest its programs? will they realise how  
dire the situation is or will they capitulate and accept it?

Simultaneously in 2007 they are announcing from Texas to Indiana,  
from Oregon to New York, that foreign companies are being given, at  
fire sale prices, the infrastructure of America. The ports and the  
roads are to be used as taxing mechanisms to fund the North American  
Union. Toll roads are to be placed upon existing roads in Security  
Prosperity Partnership agreements that bypasses Congress, agreements  
between the bureaucracies of the US and Mexican governments, to raise  
capital to build the Super highway that will go South of Texas and  
into Mexico.

SPP documents reveal that out of 85 interstate highways, 83 of them  
are slated to go under this agreement and toll roads are going down  
on them already. The money from this operation with further fund the  
dismantling of US sovereignty by seizing the infrastructure at it's  
very heart in a bloodless coup.

The US is now being used as the primary tool of globalist corporate  
fascism and the world is wrongly blaming the people of America for  
all the ills that they perceive the US to be responsible for.

In 2007 Americans need to send a message to the rest of the world  
that they are being used as puppets and are committed to fighting  
back against the hijacking of their country. Parasites have attacked  
the central nervous system of America, they have taken control of the  
central government and expanded it's power, seized full control of  
the nation and turned it into an engine of warfare to dominate other  
nations. And once they take over those other nations, they will turn  
them into engines of warfare to project and expand the power.

In order to revive America, its people need to expose the hijackers,  
the new world order crime syndicate, and their programs and  
operations. Then people on the left and right can wake up from this  
false paradigm and see that both parties are controlled by the same  
private interest groups.

Americans also need to send a message to the rest of the world and  
punish those who have enabled its downfall, such as a President who  
has been played by private interest power mongers who have no  
allegiance to the Constitution. The people need to show that they do  
not stand for the crimes for which America has been used to commit.

Such action by the informed and educated people of America will  
represent a bolt of electricity passing through the heart of the  
country and reviving it. Without this the end game will be completed  
and America will remain forever cold and dead.

>> every Alex Jones film, dozens of other documentaries! Click here to
>> subscribe!
>> --------------------------------------------------------------------- 
>> ---
>> ---------------------------------------
>>
>> Social Security, roads, military, intelligence gathering,
>> regulations, federal agencies - all within the US, Canada and Mexico
>> are being merged into one system at the cost of national sovereignty
>> and the common law. What we were is being replaced with the new - no
>> liberty, no due process, no freedom, no families, forced drugging, no
>> jobs of any significance, no control of your own destiny - in short,
>> total control of our lives.
>>
>> They are not just in name merging the agencies and the laws and the
>> regulations, they are physically getting rid of the borders by buying
>> off and lobbying the politicians at the state level, who then hand
>> the roads over to international bodies and their subsidiary  
>> companies.
>>
>> The armed forces has also seen an influx of foreign troops, an
>> average of 20% of ground troops in Iraq are now non citizens, this is
>> set to rise to 50% over the next year with foreign recruitment
>> stations facilitating the supply.
>>
>> Think about this, non-US citizens wearing the uniform of American
>> soldiers. These troops would be more likely to fire on US citizens
>> and follow orders. Every empire, when it represses its own people,
>> brings in foreign troops to do the job. Urban warfare drills we have
>> covered over the years show that the military is being prepared for
>> this.
>>
>> 2007 will be the year of the American Union's fruition. Will the
>> people stand up to it and protest its programs? will they realise how
>> dire the situation is or will they capitulate and accept it?
>>
>> Simultaneously in 2007 they are announcing from Texas to Indiana,
>> from Oregon to New York, that foreign companies are being given, at
>> fire sale prices, the infrastructure of America. The ports and the
>> roads are to be used as taxing mechanisms to fund the North American
>> Union. Toll roads are to be placed upon existing roads in Security
>> Prosperity Partnership agreements that bypasses Congress, agreements
>> between the bureaucracies of the US and Mexican governments, to raise
>> capital to build the Super highway that will go South of Texas and
>> into Mexico.
>>
>> SPP documents reveal that out of 85 interstate highways, 83 of them
>> are slated to go under this agreement and toll roads are going down
>> on them already. The money from this operation with further fund the
>> dismantling of US sovereignty by seizing the infrastructure at it's
>> very heart in a bloodless coup.
>>
>> The US is now being used as the primary tool of globalist corporate
>> fascism and the world is wrongly blaming the people of America for
>> all the ills that they perceive the US to be responsible for.
>>
>> In 2007 Americans need to send a message to the rest of the world
>> that they are being used as puppets and are committed to fighting
>> back against the hijacking of their country. Parasites have attacked
>> the central nervous system of America, they have taken control of the
>> central government and expanded it's power, seized full control of
>> the nation and turned it into an engine of warfare to dominate other
>> nations. And once they take over those other nations, they will turn
>> them into engines of warfare to project and expand the power.
>>
>> In order to revive America, its people need to expose the hijackers,
>> the new world order crime syndicate, and their programs and
>> operations. Then people on the left and right can wake up from this
>> false paradigm and see that both parties are controlled by the same
>> private interest groups.
>>
>> Americans also need to send a message to the rest of the world and
>> punish those who have enabled its downfall, such as a President who
>> has been played by private interest power mongers who have no
>> allegiance to the Constitution. The people need to show that they do
>> not stand for the crimes for which America has been used to commit.
>>
>> Such action by the informed and educated people of America will
>> represent a bolt of electricity passing through the heart of the
>> country and reviving it. Without this the end game will be completed
>> and America will remain forever cold and dead.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] (nrr) 2006: The Year America Died

oh, i've been to mexico, where they have armed military on the toll  
roads and stop everyone to ask you for your papers and what you're  
doing there.  it's worse in other places like china for instance.

but it sounds like you have a defeatist attitude that no matter what  
we do we can't win.  that's not true.  we can win.

the banking system that directs about 95% of the nastiest of nasty  
stuff is owned by about 20 families.  the general population of just  
about any country outnumbers that.  the only thing that's holding us  
back is information.  the europeans voted down the acceleration of  
the EU and we can do the same, unless you're sure they won't put  
armed military on all the new toll roads asking for your papers.

make sure the people around you are aware of this stuff and let  
*them* decide if it's a quack conspiracy or not.

i've said about all i can say here.  i hope this encourages some of  
you to do actual research on your own!

-d

It's getting worse here as well.  Look what Big Brother Sam is up to now,
and who's to say this isn't already happening to US Citizens?  See Excerpt
below, complete article at:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/main.jhtml;jsessionid=VL4HVZGOUZETRQFIQMFCFFOAVCBQYIV0?xml=/news/2007/01/01/nusnoop01.xml

Bush administration plans further invasions of privacy for foreign visitors
to the U.S.

Britons flying to America could have their credit card and email accounts
inspected by the United States authorities following a deal struck by
Brussels and Washington.

By using a credit card to book a flight, passengers face having other
transactions on the card inspected by the American authorities. Providing an
email address to an airline could also lead to scrutiny of other messages
sent or received on that account.

The extent of the demands were disclosed in "undertakings" given by the US
Department of Homeland Security to the European Union and published by the
Department for Transport after a Freedom of Information request.

About four million Britons travel to America each year and the released
document shows that the US has demanded access to far more data than
previously realised.
<end excerpt>

Subject: [sfraves] bsp: Sat.Jan.6 [KONTROL] w/ Daniel Bell & Matthew Dear LIVE!

Saturday, January 6th

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every first Saturday at the Endup


featuring from Berlin, Germany:

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D>  DANIEL BELL aka DBX  <=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D

Accelerate . 7th City . Plus 8 . M-nus . Perlon

The master of minimal returns!  When Dan Bell takes
the decks, it's over. You will dance. No one can move a
dancefloor like this man. Everything there is to be said
has already been said. Just be there, and prepare for
one of the greatest nights out you've experienced in SF.


and from Ann Arbor, Michigan:

=3D=3D=3D> MATTHEW DEAR aka AUDION - LIVE! <=3D=3D=3D

Spectral Sound . Plus 8 . M-nus . Perlon

If you've heard Matthew's amazing DJ sets, you've only
heard half the story.  This month, alongside one of his
personal heroes, Mr. Dear will dip into his entire arsenal
of original material to rip SF a new one. Seriously, you
do not want to miss this one.  ...As if you would!


plus special guest from Winnipeg, Canada:

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D>  S=DCZ  <=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D

Archipel . Unfoundsound . De'fchild

We always knew that S=FCz had great taste in music, but
recently we've discovered the girl can lay down some
tracks, too!  Her "Montreal Jones" mix was one of our
hands down favorites of 2005, and we are supremely
excited to showcase her talent at a proper SF getdown.

____________________________________________________


BIO: DANIEL BELL

Born in Sacramento, California, Daniel Bell grew up outside of
Toronto, Canada, and then moved to Detroit where he collaborated with
Richie Hawtin as Cybersonik for three years on Plus 8 Records. In
1991, he started his own label, Accelerate, on which he released his
influential releases as DBX. Based on nearby Chicago "track" records,
he reduced that sound further into funky, streamlined grooves. The
formula proved to be successful and helped launch a new aesthetic in
techno and house music known as "minimal".

With the overwhelming success of his "Losing Control" single in 1994,
Daniel set up 7th City Distribution in order to assist smaller Midwest
labels to get distribution in overseas markets. He also created three
new labels - 7th City, Elevate and Harmonie Park. In 2000, he
relocated to Berlin, Germany, and released his first mix CD, "The
Button-Down Mind of Daniel Bell", on Tresor Records, followed in 2003
by "The Button-Down Mind Strikes Back!" He since has produced a series
of remixes for a diverse range of artists, includng John Tejada,
Pantytec, Akufen and John Thomas. He has spent the last 3 years
traveling and DJing around the world.


Daniel Bell's website:
http://www.daniel-bell.com/

Daniel Bell's discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Daniel%20Bell

Daniel Bell interview on InTheMix.com:
http://www.inthemix.com.au/features/23336/

_________________________________________________


BIO: MATTHEW DEAR

You could throw around generous descriptors and any number of
genre-locking terms =96 minimal house, acid techno, electronic pop =96 but
you'd still fail to get to the center of Matthew Dear. With releases
under no fewer than three aliases, including False (M_NUS), Jabberjaw
(Perlon), and Audion (Spectral Sound), the Texas native has earned his
international status over the course of a decade, from getting his
bearings on the DJ decks as a teenager to flooring sold-out crowds at
venues like Fabric and releasing universally-praised original
recordings.

After meeting Ghostly founder Sam Valenti at a house party in the late
90s, Dear eventually produced the A-Side for the label's first 12"
release Hands Up for Detroit. Since becoming the flagship artist for
the dancefloor-oriented Spectral Sound offshoot, Dear has created the
albums Leave Luck to Heaven and Backstroke under his birth name, as
well as a series of singles and the Suckfish LP as Audion, all the
while building a reputation for some of the most evolved live
electronic sets ever crafted. He'll still tell you that his greatest
pleasure is a quiet day of fishing, but with plans for a new Audion
single (split with Ellen Allien, no less) and another full-length
under his proper name, it's clear that Dear has no intention of
slowing down anytime soon.


AUDION website:
http://www.suckfish.org/

Matthew Dear website:
http://www.matthewdear.com/

Matthew Dear's discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Matthew%20Dear

Subject: [sfraves] RIP Wes Robinson. A Final thanks to Wes Robinson..., The man behind the Crack house!

------=_Part_1726_26931442.1167881245843
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

"well, i hate to be the one to say the bad news but i think all you guys
should know...

Wes Robinson has passed on! the man in his late 70's was found dead on
december 30th by one of his daughters early that morning, if you guys didnt
know Wes, he was one of the main managers at the venue known as the crack
house! He also was one of the main ppl to bring you the party "Fuck Da Dumb
Shit" witch went very well thanx to all that attended! All the proceeds will
be donated to his family for outstanding debts, cost of his funeral, ect...

Wes Robinson lived for music and will always be remembered for it. Wes was
not only involved in our scene but was multi involved in a number of
projects as well, we will miss you Wes and all that you have brought to the
table for our scene!


R.I.P. hommie, you will be missed! "

I got that news from my friend chris. I'm pretty sad about the whole thing.
I first worked with Wes in 1999 when I did a show called infinity. I then
went on to work with Wes on about 12 other shows. He is one of those people
that were always in the back drop of our scene, and was instrumental in
keeping it together. The crack house and Wes's memory will live in our
hearts and memory for as long as we are around.

Thank you Wes for everything you did, you are and were a good man. You will
not be forgot.

-- 
Nick Sideshow
---------------------------
DTS Collective

------=_Part_1726_26931442.1167881245843--

Subject: [sfraves] (nrr) QOD (Thu)

OK, so I'm glad people on the list are thinking about this stuff.  As  
is always the case with an open forum, the important thing is not  
that we all agree on everything, but the opinions are out there.  I  
don't have too much time today to devote to getting into the debate,  
though I'd like to, because I feel like some of you are starting to  
realize your unique value as an American citizen and having  
experienced the wonderful open-minded intellectual culture of San  
Francisco ravers.  Whether you realize it or not, you're a little bit  
above this false left-right liberal vs. conservative crap.  Remember  
that and hang on to it!

I'll leave you today with a thought, one of my temp jobs back in the  
90's I told this lady I go to raves, and her response was to ask me  
what kind of dance we do at them.  I was oblivious to what that  
meant, because I never went to school dances, in fact never got into  
dancing until I found raves in 1991.  The thought is, there is no  
right or wrong way to dance.  Just be yourself!

--

Oh, I made a bundt cake!

- Erin Brockovich

Dam.... I never post here anymore but still lurk now and then, had to post on this though. I worked with Wes quite a bit back in the day. As part of Children of the Sun we through a bunch of parties at the crack house and Wes was a cool guy, definatley quite the character... but a really cool guy. This is really sad news. RIP Wes, you will be missed.
   
  Kj

Nick SideShow <nick.sideshow@gmail.com> wrote:
  "well, i hate to be the one to say the bad news but i think all you guys
should know...

Wes Robinson has passed on! the man in his late 70's was found dead on
december 30th by one of his daughters early that morning, if you guys didnt
know Wes, he was one of the main managers at the venue known as the crack
house! He also was one of the main ppl to bring you the party "Fuck Da Dumb
Shit" witch went very well thanx to all that attended! All the proceeds will
be donated to his family for outstanding debts, cost of his funeral, ect...

Wes Robinson lived for music and will always be remembered for it. Wes was
not only involved in our scene but was multi involved in a number of
projects as well, we will miss you Wes and all that you have brought to the
table for our scene!


R.I.P. hommie, you will be missed! "

I got that news from my friend chris. I'm pretty sad about the whole thing.
I first worked with Wes in 1999 when I did a show called infinity. I then
went on to work with Wes on about 12 other shows. He is one of those people
that were always in the back drop of our scene, and was instrumental in
keeping it together. The crack house and Wes's memory will live in our
hearts and memory for as long as we are around.

Thank you Wes for everything you did, you are and were a good man. You will
not be forgot.

-- 
Nick Sideshow

I remember doing visuals at the Crackhouse for most of the COTS parties, 
(hi Kj!) I also remember doing a bunch of others there: Warmth, 
ASR, First Light, etc... :-)

Wes was cool, he'd let me mount projectors in his loft/live area. I 
remember helping Spencer(Warmth) soundproof the roof with carpeting (in 
mid-party after a sound-complaint). That was a nutty space, got busted *a 
lot*, yet would never die!

Wes put up with a lot of shit running that space, hope he's in a better 
place now :-(

-terry

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Cheapest, easiest to use and best interfaces??

------=_Part_17770_28349406.1167953285575
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

i think you need something more like a midi controller + audio interface
like the M-audio Ozone
http://www.m-audio.com/products/en_us/MAudioOzone-main.html
or just a plain audio interface like The FireWire Solo
http://www.m-audio.com/products/en_us/FireWireSolo-main.html
or the one i have a PreSonus Firebox http://www.presonus.com/firebox.html

It all depends on how many inputs/outputs you need or may want in the
future. and if midi IN/Out are important
If your on a tight budget M-audio has lots of solutions.
I personally think its very important to go with firewire instead of USB i
had lots of issues with usb

most bring bundled software as well. i personally think ableton live is the
most intuitive.

hope it helps.
any questions just ask.


Thomas May
(415) 550-8935

------=_Part_17770_28349406.1167953285575--

seperately, I guess I could.

Okay then I need to know what the cheapest and easiest to use software
studio  program is
that will go with the interface. 

thanks

Man.. so many memories of so many great parties thrown by several different crews back in the day, all made possible by Wes and that space. Simply legendary. God i miss those days.

Terry Estioko <terry@hyperreal.org> wrote:
  I remember doing visuals at the Crackhouse for most of the COTS parties, 
(hi Kj!) I also remember doing a bunch of others there: Warmth, 
ASR, First Light, etc... :-)

Wes was cool, he'd let me mount projectors in his loft/live area. I 
remember helping Spencer(Warmth) soundproof the roof with carpeting (in 
mid-party after a sound-complaint). That was a nutty space, got busted *a 
lot*, yet would never die!

Wes put up with a lot of shit running that space, hope he's in a better 
place now :-(

-terry

On Thu, 4 Jan 2007, Kevin James wrote:

> Dam.... I never post here anymore but still lurk now and then, had to post on this though. I worked with Wes quite a bit back in the day. As part of Children of the Sun we through a bunch of parties at the crack house and Wes was a cool guy, definatley quite the character... but a really cool guy. This is really sad news. RIP Wes, you will be missed.
>
> Kj
>
> Nick SideShow wrote:
> "well, i hate to be the one to say the bad news but i think all you guys
> should know...
>
> Wes Robinson has passed on! the man in his late 70's was found dead on
> december 30th by one of his daughters early that morning, if you guys didnt
> know Wes, he was one of the main managers at the venue known as the crack
> house! He also was one of the main ppl to bring you the party "Fuck Da Dumb
> Shit" witch went very well thanx to all that attended! All the proceeds will
> be donated to his family for outstanding debts, cost of his funeral, ect...
>
> Wes Robinson lived for music and will always be remembered for it. Wes was
> not only involved in our scene but was multi involved in a number of
> projects as well, we will miss you Wes and all that you have brought to the
> table for our scene!
>
>
> R.I.P. hommie, you will be missed! "
>
> I got that news from my friend chris. I'm pretty sad about the whole thing.
> I first worked with Wes in 1999 when I did a show called infinity. I then
> went on to work with Wes on about 12 other shows. He is one of those people
> that were always in the back drop of our scene, and was instrumental in
> keeping it together. The crack house and Wes's memory will live in our
> hearts and memory for as long as we are around.
>
> Thank you Wes for everything you did, you are and were a good man. You will
> not be forgot.
>

this is one definition of secular -

1 denoting attitudes, activities, or other things that have no  
religious or spiritual basis : secular buildings | secular moral  
theory. Contrasted with sacred

now, i thought we already had this.  it's written into something  
called the first amendment.

Congress shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion,  
or prohibiting the free exercise thereof ...

we have a guy running the country that views this iraq war as some  
kind of crusade that god (and probably pat robertson) told him to do,  
and issues signing statements to back his plan, if he even has one  
anymore ... i guess that's not secular.

I think the key point is that CONGRESS didn't state that God told them to 
go war.

Politicians have always been free to have their own beliefs, and even makes 
their descisions base don those beliefs.

1st ammendment is about laws specifically passed stateing what is the 
OFFICIAL religion or what religions are BANNED.  The only real time the 
siubject of banned comes up is for tax reasons, and they ae fully allowed 
by the constitution to discriminate on that level.  They arn't telling 
somebody that can't practice some religion they made up last week, but they 
certainly arn't going to get tax exempt status because of it.

that is chocolate rations weren't cut as much as we expected so  
that's good news too!  <-- a little joke for anyone that's seen 1984.

i've never read many articles from them.  if what shatter says is  
true, though, then i would have to say this is one of those left  
"gatekeeper" sites, chilling words by the way, from someone that used  
to call himself a gatekeeper and had a whole formula on what one was.

but anyway, someone like noam chomsky is a perfect example of a left  
gatekeeper type.  a total bore in my book, but some of the hippie  
types seem to love him because he talks in that NPR speak.  but  
there's more.  saying we should just forget about 9/11.  even saying  
so what if 9/11 was an inside job and so what if the kennedy  
assassination was an inside job.  is noam chomsky really just a CIA  
controlled asset?

i would have to say if you find a wide variety of sources that say  
the same thing, and i don't mean you went to fox news, cnn, and npr  
and just because they all said the same thing means it's the truth.   
i mean real research.  that takes time.  then maybe it's credible.   
but data can be skewed any which way.

Well, have you been to prison recently?  I haven't, but I don't really thin=
k its that fun.  I was in jail overnight once and that sucked balls.  =0A=
=0AMoreover, you need to consider the actual costs of the death penalty=0Ai=
n our country wherein nearly endless appeals are pursued over the course of=
 years or=0Aeven decades.  I think it is less than obvious that the death=
=0Apenalty is really about saving money; IMO it is more about exacting=0Are=
venge.  =0A=0AOf course you could adopt the Chinese model where they just k=
ill people quickly to avoid all the messy and expensive appeals.  They even=
 have a mobile execution chamber a sort of "death RV" for this purpose.  Th=
ey execute lots of people very efficiently there, in fact more than the res=
t of the world combined.  (see http://futurecrime.wordpress.com/2006/09/14/=
chinese-computer-court-and-the-death-penalty/)=0A=0AI agree with you about =
the need to address the larger issue with the "prison industrial complex" a=
nd jailing people for clearly victimless crimes.     Unfortunately over the=
 past several decades the trend has been to make more things criminal, a tr=
end I call "everyone is a criminal",  and to increase penalties for crimes =
in general. Consider the new set of laws governing intellectual property an=
d circumvention of copy protection and three strikes laws as an example.  =
=0A=0APerhaps instead of obsessing about conspiracies we can't prove, we co=
uld work to revise the legal system that jails thousands of people for thin=
gs which shouldn't be crimes at all.  Maybe I'm deluded in imagining that t=
his is really possible, but I don't think so.  =0A=0AYou need to start some=
where, and ending the nonsensical notion that killing more people will decr=
ease violence or make us safer seems like a good place to start to me.  Of =
course as a Buddhist I can't support the death penalty even if it saves mon=
ey.  YMMV.=0A=0APeace,=0A=0APeter=0A=0A----- Original Message ----=0AFrom: =

http://www.beachimpeach.org/

Dear Friends,
On Saturday, January 6, 2007 (just two days after the new US Congress convenes), 1,200 people will gather for an impeachment event in Nancy Pelosi’s back yard — on Ocean Beach in San Francisco.

Early that morning, in 100-foot letters stretching 450 feet across the sand, volunteers from the Beach Impeach Project will outline the message:

I M P E A C H !

At 10:30, the attendees will arrive and lay their bodies down inside the message’s lettering. At 11 a.m. a helicopter will arrive overhead and photographers will record the 1,200 bodies in the sand — “IMPEACH!” — with the San Francisco skyline and the Golden Gate Bridge in the background.

News editors will have compelling photos for the next morning’s Sunday papers; the nation and world will have convincing evidence of how badly the American people (even Ms. Pelosi’s own constituency) want their leaders held accountable for the Iraq disaster; and the impeachment movement will have powerful visuals to go with the words and chatter swirling in the air for months and months.

 __________________________________________________

From: Uncle Noah <unclenoah@yahoo.com>

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: RE: [sfraves] Cheapest, easiest to use and best interfaces??


I 100% agree here -- at the very least, you need to
pick up a book or two on how to make electronic music
and go through all the steps first before you just
start buying gear and software that you have no idea
how to use.

There are so many different products out there and so
many different methods for accomplishing the tasks of
composing, recording, arranging, mastering, etc. that
it's impossible to point to a single, best solution --
the best solution for you will depend on many factors
related to hwo you work and what kinds of recordings
you're looking to make.

Many community colleges have classes in recording and
electronic music -- I think it would be a really wise
investment to go through some kind of course to
familiarize yourself with the process and products
available before you start throwing money at the
situation.

And one last point -- never *never* ask the guy at
Guitar Center/Sam Ash/etc. to tell you what to buy. 
They'll always find the most expensive solution they
can sell you because (duh!) the sales folks in those
stores work on commission!  They'll try to get you to
buy as much stuff as you can afford to buy, not the
best stuff for your needs.

>From: dangrsmind@yahoo.com
>To: sfraves@hyperreal.org
>Subject: Re: [sfraves] NRR: Good news for today
>Date: Thu, 4 Jan 2007 22:04:00 -0800 (PST)
>
>Personally I don't think anyone should be required to swear on a particular 
>religious text or any text at all.
>
>Making someone swear on a book which they don't believe in makes no sense 
>to me.  Some people do follow traditions wherein such an oath has meaning 
>of course and therefore using the matching book makes sense if that's the 
>tradition they want to follow.  Seems to me that this is exactly what 
>happened today.
>
>People should be free to believe whatever they want, but in politics those 
>beliefs need to be out in the open.  In general I don't care if you worship 
>Christ or Cthulhu, but if you are going to run for mayor I might want to 
>understand how either of those beliefs would impact your decisions.
>
>I think this story counts as good news because a lot of people have been 
>concerned that America is slipping into some sort of ultra-right Christian 
>fascist state.  And it may yet become something like that.  But here we see 
>a story that clearly shows an entirely different sort of America in ascent; 
>where the tremendous diversity in background and culture is valued and 
>celebrated as one of the greatest strengths of our country.
>
>Peace,
>
>Peter
>
>P.S. I think it is hilarious that a Christian has the email address 
>"godhatesu"  Where's the love?

>Dear Friends,
>On Saturday, January 6, 2007 (just two days after the new US Congress 
>convenes), 1,200 people will gather for an impeachment event in Nancy 
>Pelosi’s back yard — on Ocean Beach in San Francisco.
>
>Early that morning, in 100-foot letters stretching 450 feet across the 
>sand, volunteers from the Beach Impeach Project will outline the message:
>
>I M P E A C H !
>
>At 10:30, the attendees will arrive and lay their bodies down inside the 
>message’s lettering. At 11 a.m. a helicopter will arrive overhead and 
>photographers will record the 1,200 bodies in the sand — “IMPEACH!” — with 
>the San Francisco skyline and the Golden Gate Bridge in the background.
>
>News editors will have compelling photos for the next morning’s Sunday 
>papers; the nation and world will have convincing evidence of how badly the 
>American people (even Ms. Pelosi’s own constituency) want their leaders 
>held accountable for the Iraq disaster; and the impeachment movement will 
>have powerful visuals to go with the words and chatter swirling in the air 
>for months and months.

Impeachable offense.... hmmm   I can think of more than just one offense
Bush Co. has committed.

Here are a few of them, but of course, the usual smoke and mirror tactics o=
f
deceit will be deployed (and already have been) to convince the public,
opponents, judges, etc, that the President has acted in  good faith in
abiding the constitution, Geneva conventions, US Law, etc.

NSA wiretapping of americans without warrants, ignoring the procedures of
the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act (FISA).

The now famous Downing Street Memo, along with the testimony of former
Treasury Secretary Paul O'Neil constitute direct evidence of a decision by
Bush to invade a sovereign foreign nation on entirely specious grounds.

Authorizing torture of POW's - a direct violation of the protocols of the
Geneva Convention

Holding so called "non-combatant civilians" for an indefinite period of tim=
e
,depriving them of their day in court ,acess to counsel, and acess to famil=
y
members who could plead their cause to the public.


I think I'm going to make it out to the beach, maybe head up to towards the
cliffhouse to get a better view to see if they can really pull this off.

> 
> I 100% agree here -- at the very least, you need to
> pick up a book or two on how to make electronic music
> and go through all the steps first before you just
> start buying gear and software that you have no idea
> how to use.
> 
> There are so many different products out there and so
> many different methods for accomplishing the tasks of
> composing, recording, arranging, mastering, etc. that
> it's impossible to point to a single, best solution --
> the best solution for you will depend on many factors
> related to hwo you work and what kinds of recordings
> you're looking to make.
> 
> Many community colleges have classes in recording and
> electronic music -- I think it would be a really wise
> investment to go through some kind of course to
> familiarize yourself with the process and products
> available before you start throwing money at the
> situation.
> 
> And one last point -- never *never* ask the guy at
> Guitar Center/Sam Ash/etc. to tell you what to buy. 
> They'll always find the most expensive solution they
> can sell you because (duh!) the sales folks in those
> stores work on commission!  They'll try to get you to
> buy as much stuff as you can afford to buy, not the
> best stuff for your needs.
>

you know, i've read the articles you posted and i haven't found *one*  
thing that convinces me that jeff rense is anything but anti-zionist  
for the reasons of basically holding grossly unchecked power over  
innocent Jewish and Israeli people.  in fact, from reading them, i've  
been able to determine that the term "anti-semetic" actually refers  
to a whole region of people in the middle east, so saying "anti- 
semetic" might be something more equivalent to saying you're against  
all people in the mid-atlantic region of the united states or against  
all orgeonians.  nothing to do with religion!

as far as noam chomsky is concerned, i've never heard him say or seen  
him write anything that makes me think he's a credible source for  
information or opinion on *any* subject; in fact, his recent comments  
about suggesting we shouldn't care that 9/11 was an inside job or the  
kennedy assassination was pretty much the same make me really suspect  
he's just a puppet of the new world order simply posing as a phony  
liberal; though i am not going to go around telling people they  
shouldn't listen to him.  go ahead, he's all over the internet,  
television, and national petroleum radio.  decide for yourself.   
certainly don't take my word for it.

anyway, i pulled some interesting quotes off these articles to share  
with everyone, and i especially like the first quote because it sums  
up what the banking system likes the most, and that is to keep  
countries constantly at war with each other so they can constantly  
profit off it, keep governments in perpetual debt, and keep you, the  
citizen, constantly paying for it through taxes and the biggest  
hidden tax called inflation.  if you haven't read G. Edward Griffin's  
Creature from Jekyll Island, I suggest you get yourself a copy, like  
YESTERDAY.

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Cheapest, easiest to use and best interfaces??

Well vs Mr Jackson I think that might be a stretch :)

Sorry for assuming otherwise- those of us on many music and gear  
lists see posts like yours all the time-
I thought you were just some dumb kid too-

I mean- it is kinda strange that you have a computer, and have synths  
etc- but you've *never* ever looked in to a midi interface for your  
computer?
Or used the soundcard on the computer?

I dunno- i find that a little weird-

Also- since you have no clue- do you really need to live multitrack?
All these audio interfaces do (in a very general sense) is provide a  
high-quality purpose-built soundcard- some providing things useful  
like multiple simultaneous inputs.
If you don't need live multitracking (you're just recording one part  
at a time) fuck it- just use the soundcard you've already got.

Get some software (Audacity is free) and you can arrange and effect  
all your tracks all you want.

On Fri, 5 Jan 2007 11:17:15 -0800 (PST), "Uncle Noah"
<unclenoah@yahoo.com> said:
> 
> I 100% agree here -- at the very least, you need to
> pick up a book or two on how to make electronic music
> and go through all the steps first before you just
> start buying gear and software that you have no idea
> how to use.
> 
> There are so many different products out there and so
> many different methods for accomplishing the tasks of
> composing, recording, arranging, mastering, etc. that
> it's impossible to point to a single, best solution --
> the best solution for you will depend on many factors
> related to hwo you work and what kinds of recordings
> you're looking to make.
> 
> Many community colleges have classes in recording and
> electronic music -- I think it would be a really wise
> investment to go through some kind of course to
> familiarize yourself with the process and products
> available before you start throwing money at the
> situation.
> 
> And one last point -- never *never* ask the guy at
> Guitar Center/Sam Ash/etc. to tell you what to buy. 
> They'll always find the most expensive solution they
> can sell you because (duh!) the sales folks in those
> stores work on commission!  They'll try to get you to
> buy as much stuff as you can afford to buy, not the
> best stuff for your needs.
> 
>

On Fri, 5 Jan 2007 11:17:15 -0800 (PST), "Uncle Noah"
<unclenoah@yahoo.com> said:
> 
> I 100% agree here -- at the very least, you need to
> pick up a book or two on how to make electronic music
> and go through all the steps first before you just
> start buying gear and software that you have no idea
> how to use.
> 
> There are so many different products out there and so
> many different methods for accomplishing the tasks of
> composing, recording, arranging, mastering, etc. that
> it's impossible to point to a single, best solution --
> the best solution for you will depend on many factors
> related to hwo you work and what kinds of recordings
> you're looking to make.
> 
> Many community colleges have classes in recording and
> electronic music -- I think it would be a really wise
> investment to go through some kind of course to
> familiarize yourself with the process and products
> available before you start throwing money at the
> situation.
> 
> And one last point -- never *never* ask the guy at
> Guitar Center/Sam Ash/etc. to tell you what to buy. 
> They'll always find the most expensive solution they
> can sell you because (duh!) the sales folks in those
> stores work on commission!  They'll try to get you to
> buy as much stuff as you can afford to buy, not the
> best stuff for your needs.
> 
>

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every first Saturday at the Endup


featuring from Berlin, Germany:

Accelerate . 7th City . Plus 8 . M-nus . Perlon

the decks, it's over. You will dance. No one can move a
dancefloor like this man. Everything there is to be said
has already been said. Just be there, and prepare for
one of the greatest nights out you've experienced in SF.


and from Ann Arbor, Michigan:

=3D=3D=3D> MATTHEW DEAR aka AUDION - LIVE! <=3D=3D=3D

Spectral Sound . Plus 8 . M-nus . Perlon

If you've heard Matthew's amazing DJ sets, you've only
heard half the story.  This month, alongside one of his
personal heroes, Mr. Dear will dip into his entire arsenal
of original material to rip SF a new one. Seriously, you
do not want to miss this one.  ...As if you would!


plus special guest from Winnipeg, Canada:

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D>  S=DCZ  <=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D

Archipel . Unfoundsound . De'fchild

recently we've discovered the girl can lay down some
tracks, too!  Her "Montreal Jones" mix was one of our
hands down favorites of 2005, and we are supremely
excited to showcase her talent at a proper SF getdown.

____________________________________________________


BIO: DANIEL BELL

Born in Sacramento, California, Daniel Bell grew up outside of
Toronto, Canada, and then moved to Detroit where he collaborated with
Richie Hawtin as Cybersonik for three years on Plus 8 Records. In
1991, he started his own label, Accelerate, on which he released his
influential releases as DBX. Based on nearby Chicago "track" records,
he reduced that sound further into funky, streamlined grooves. The
formula proved to be successful and helped launch a new aesthetic in
techno and house music known as "minimal".

With the overwhelming success of his "Losing Control" single in 1994,
Daniel set up 7th City Distribution in order to assist smaller Midwest
labels to get distribution in overseas markets. He also created three
new labels - 7th City, Elevate and Harmonie Park. In 2000, he
relocated to Berlin, Germany, and released his first mix CD, "The
Button-Down Mind of Daniel Bell", on Tresor Records, followed in 2003
by "The Button-Down Mind Strikes Back!" He since has produced a series
of remixes for a diverse range of artists, includng John Tejada,
Pantytec, Akufen and John Thomas. He has spent the last 3 years
traveling and DJing around the world.


Daniel Bell's website:
http://www.daniel-bell.com/

Daniel Bell's discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Daniel%20Bell

Daniel Bell interview on InTheMix.com:
http://www.inthemix.com.au/features/23336/

http://www.demf.com/sounds/2006/hmay/05-27-06_danielbell_movement06.ram

_________________________________________________


BIO: MATTHEW DEAR

You could throw around generous descriptors and any number of
genre-locking terms =96 minimal house, acid techno, electronic pop =96 but
you'd still fail to get to the center of Matthew Dear. With releases
under no fewer than three aliases, including False (M_NUS), Jabberjaw
(Perlon), and Audion (Spectral Sound), the Texas native has earned his
international status over the course of a decade, from getting his
bearings on the DJ decks as a teenager to flooring sold-out crowds at
venues like Fabric and releasing universally-praised original
recordings.

After meeting Ghostly founder Sam Valenti at a house party in the late
90s, Dear eventually produced the A-Side for the label's first 12"
release Hands Up for Detroit. Since becoming the flagship artist for
the dancefloor-oriented Spectral Sound offshoot, Dear has created the
albums Leave Luck to Heaven and Backstroke under his birth name, as
well as a series of singles and the Suckfish LP as Audion, all the
while building a reputation for some of the most evolved live
electronic sets ever crafted. He'll still tell you that his greatest
pleasure is a quiet day of fishing, but with plans for a new Audion
single (split with Ellen Allien, no less) and another full-length
under his proper name, it's clear that Dear has no intention of
slowing down anytime soon.


AUDION website:
http://www.suckfish.org/

Matthew Dear website:
http://www.matthewdear.com/

Matthew Dear's discography:
http://www.discogs.com/artist/Matthew%20Dear

Subject: Re: [sfraves] Cheapest, easiest to use and best interfaces??

Um, dude, you just made a huge mistake. This list is full of producers
and DJ's that have tons of knowledge from the most obscure Russian
synths to musical theory masters. Some here have in fact work(ed) for
major musical equipment HW/SW manufacturers and helped create what you
own. Maybe you were the top dog in the studio in the 70's, but this is
the 21st century. Things have changed. If you ever want any digital
music help feel free to send me an e-mail or hit me up on AIM at
NSXFGC.

my personal bio (let me see how far I can pee...):
President of the midi club at Piedmont Hills HS. 92-94
De Anza college electronic music 101 & 102 94-95
Music theory Cal Poly SLO
Worked for Steinberg, M-Audio, Pinnacle Systems
Played in bands: The Fuzzy Green Carpets, Seriphin, Scissors for lefty

> On Fri, 5 Jan 2007 11:17:15 -0800 (PST), "Uncle Noah"
> <unclenoah@yahoo.com> said:
> >
> > I 100% agree here -- at the very least, you need to
> > pick up a book or two on how to make electronic music
> > and go through all the steps first before you just
> > start buying gear and software that you have no idea
> > how to use.
> >
> > There are so many different products out there and so
> > many different methods for accomplishing the tasks of
> > composing, recording, arranging, mastering, etc. that
> > it's impossible to point to a single, best solution --
> > the best solution for you will depend on many factors
> > related to hwo you work and what kinds of recordings
> > you're looking to make.
> >
> > Many community colleges have classes in recording and
> > electronic music -- I think it would be a really wise
> > investment to go through some kind of course to
> > familiarize yourself with the process and products
> > available before you start throwing money at the
> > situation.
> >
> > And one last point -- never *never* ask the guy at
> > Guitar Center/Sam Ash/etc. to tell you what to buy.
> > They'll always find the most expensive solution they
> > can sell you because (duh!) the sales folks in those
> > stores work on commission!  They'll try to get you to
> > buy as much stuff as you can afford to buy, not the
> > best stuff for your needs.
> >
> >

well look, i don't think anyone's saying the holocaust didn't happen,  
and anyone that would come out and say that particular statement has  
a warped sense of reality because at very least the internment camps  
did happen.

so maybe we can agree to disagree on jeff rense, but i again strongly  
recommend you read that book, and read or expose yourself to webster  
tarpley, i think he really knows what he's talking about as far as  
governments being one "continuous creeping coup" to quote him.  just  
constant backstabbing, so really it's hard to discern what to  
believe, but it's our job as citizens to discuss these things and learn.

have a nice weekend

>
> BIO: DANIEL BELL
>
> Born in Sacramento, California, Daniel Bell grew up outside of
> Toronto, Canada, and then moved to Detroit where he collaborated with
> Richie Hawtin as Cybersonik for three years on Plus 8 Records. In
> 1991, he started his own label, Accelerate, on which he released his
> influential releases as DBX. Based on nearby Chicago "track" records,
> he reduced that sound further into funky, streamlined grooves. The
> formula proved to be successful and helped launch a new aesthetic in
> techno and house music known as "minimal".
>
> With the overwhelming success of his "Losing Control" single in 1994,
> Daniel set up 7th City Distribution in order to assist smaller Midwest
> labels to get distribution in overseas markets. He also created three
> new labels - 7th City, Elevate and Harmonie Park. In 2000, he
> relocated to Berlin, Germany, and released his first mix CD, "The
> Button-Down Mind of Daniel Bell", on Tresor Records, followed in 2003
> by "The Button-Down Mind Strikes Back!" He since has produced a series
> of remixes for a diverse range of artists, includng John Tejada,
> Pantytec, Akufen and John Thomas. He has spent the last 3 years
> traveling and DJing around the world.
>
>
> Daniel Bell's website:
> http://www.daniel-bell.com/
>
> Daniel Bell's discography:
> http://www.discogs.com/artist/Daniel%20Bell
>
> Daniel Bell interview on InTheMix.com:
> http://www.inthemix.com.au/features/23336/
>
>
> AUDIO:
>
> DBX - Phreak  (mp3 sample)
> http://www.kontrolsf.com/K19/DBX_-_Phreak.mp3
>
> DBX - Losing Control  (mp3 sample)
> http://www.kontrolsf.com/K19/DBX_-_Losing Control.mp3
>

> http://www.demf.com/sounds/2006/hmay/05-27-06_danielbell_movement06.ram
>
> _________________________________________________
>
>
> BIO: MATTHEW DEAR
>
> You could throw around generous descriptors and any number of
> genre-locking terms =96 minimal house, acid techno, electronic pop =96 bu=
t
> you'd still fail to get to the center of Matthew Dear. With releases
> under no fewer than three aliases, including False (M_NUS), Jabberjaw
> (Perlon), and Audion (Spectral Sound), the Texas native has earned his
> international status over the course of a decade, from getting his
> bearings on the DJ decks as a teenager to flooring sold-out crowds at
> venues like Fabric and releasing universally-praised original
> recordings.
>
> After meeting Ghostly founder Sam Valenti at a house party in the late
> 90s, Dear eventually produced the A-Side for the label's first 12"
> release Hands Up for Detroit. Since becoming the flagship artist for
> the dancefloor-oriented Spectral Sound offshoot, Dear has created the
> albums Leave Luck to Heaven and Backstroke under his birth name, as
> well as a series of singles and the Suckfish LP as Audion, all the
> while building a reputation for some of the most evolved live
> electronic sets ever crafted. He'll still tell you that his greatest
> pleasure is a quiet day of fishing, but with plans for a new Audion
> single (split with Ellen Allien, no less) and another full-length
> under his proper name, it's clear that Dear has no intention of
> slowing down anytime soon.
>
>
> AUDION website:
> http://www.suckfish.org/
>
> Matthew Dear website:
> http://www.matthewdear.com/
>
> Matthew Dear's discography:
> http://www.discogs.com/artist/Matthew%20Dear
>

LOT of things about Barbara Boxer and impreach bush...

http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,977022-3,00.html

"Congresswoman Barbara Boxer had 143 bounced checks to account for. "

....  and she got re-elected.   To me bouncing checks is an indictable=20
crime, and therefore, impeachable.  Those in glass houses....

Anyway, impeachable offenses are generally major breaks of the=20
constitution.  Clintons case it was being a global embarissment for his=20
indescretions.

As for Bush's things...   well, we're ALL wire tapped.  All the time.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ECHELON

As for the enemy combatants...  IMHO...  They're not U.S. Citizens, I'm=20
tired of non citizens wanting constitutional protection.  I said it before=
=20
tounge and cheeck, but I meant it at heart.  Our right to protest is our=20
right, not a foreign nationals.  We certainly don't have the right to=20
protest in their country do we?  IMHO, everything from Foreign Lobbiests=20
down to foreign nationals staging prtest marches, needs to go.  Until they=
=20
want to commit to being a full fledged citizen with voting rights and pay=20
their tax gouges, here's a tall glass of STFU for them.

Another problem with U.S. is the mindset of teh criminal justice=20
system.  It's named this for a reason.  We arn't interested in the justice=
=20
for the victem, we are making sure a criminal get's justice.  I understand=
=20
the reasoning behind this, and I agree, but there's times it's taken WAY=20
too far by ultra libs and other cry babies.

Example:  you see a rape take place in an alley.  You know the women is=20
being raped because she's screaming "HELP I'M BEING RAPED".  The rapist is=
=20
still a "Suspect".  He's innocent.  What you saw means nothing until a=20
judge passes a sentence.  Refering to the Suspect in any other way can get=
=20
a mistrial.  If the evidence chain is somehow broken, mistrial.  If you as=
=20
a witness get found to have bad eyesight, have lied in the past, cheated on=
=20
taxes, missed  acar payment, or anything else, they guy could walk.  Is=20
this Justice?  The idea of being caught red handed doesn't apply.

Now, these are right granted to Americans.  I don't see any reason to=20
extend this to some foreign national who has a sole intent on killing us=20
out of general hated or being a religious zealot.

Ya....  i went off on a  tangent.  *shrug*

Subject: [sfraves] Seattle on a Friday Night

------=_Part_40513_12417467.1168128298450
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1; format=flowed
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
Content-Disposition: inline

Element Synchronicity<http://people.tribe.net/kestrachern/blog/8df226ce-1ed3-4809-b6ee-a526c63b1d3b>
Wow...
Aside from closing at 2am... Elements in Seattle is a fabulous club.
elementseattle.com/
Two separate rooms each having a dance floor about 25x25 cubby hole chill
spaces balcony and KICK ASS sound!
It is a small space.. but a great space... wait I was wrong.. the third
dance floor was closed off for tonight.. yikes..

Friday showcased Reid Speed www.reidspeed.com/ with opening set from Dig
dug... both playing sick breaks...
Reid played a DnB set in the other room but I was feeling the breaks.

The vibe on the breaks dance floor was different that the SF feel although I
am not sure exactly how.. but it still felt good.
Interestingly enough I came to find out that the only person that I danced
with turned out to be from SF and was in Seattle visiting family...

So my exploration of Seattle's nightlife is off to a good start... Saturday
looks good with three possibilities and Monday shows promise.... sadly
nothing yet on Sunday.... I may have no choice but to rest.... :P

Hope Friday in SF was at least as much fun

------=_Part_40513_12417467.1168128298450--

Subject: [sfraves] NRR: Good news for today

Meteorite hits New Jersey home.=0A=0AI know, I know, having a meteorite str=
ike your house doesn't sound like very good news, until you start thinking =
about it that is. First of all, assuming it didn't kill you, you are really=
 lucky!  Second, a meterorite that hit a house is worth serious bank!  Only=
 six meteorites have been verified to have struck a building in the past 40=
0 years as I understand it.=0A=0Ahttp://www.ecanadanow.com/curiosity/2007/0=
1/06/meteorite-falls-through-roof-of-house-in-new-jersey/=0Ahttp://www.nyda=
ilynews.com/front/story/486216p-409309c.html=0A=0AIt is interesting to star=
t thinking about the odds of something like this happening.  =0A=0ABack in =
1991, right before my first son was born, I was driving up Highway 9 to my =
house in the Santa Cruz mountains when a fellow driving the other direction=
 lost control of his van and struck me.  I suffered a broken rib, some nast=
y cuts, and some back injuries that still haunt me until this day.  My car =
was almost pushed over the cliff with one rear wheel fully over the side.  =
The van driver was scared shitless but was uninjured.=0A=0ABut what were th=
e chances? Both cars were traveling 35-40 miles per hour making our relativ=
e velocity in excess of 70 miles per hour.  My car, a Mazda 323, was less t=
han 20 feet long.  At that speed, a variation in timing of only a fraction =
of a second  (check the math yourself) would have meant my car wasn't there=
 when he lost control and his van would have plunged over the side .  He pr=
obably would have ended up rolling down several hundred feet of the steep m=
ountain side, where there were several broken remains of cars that had prev=
iously taken that tumble.  My car being precisely where it was when it was,=
 very likely saved this man's life.  I hope he's been making good use of th=
at second chance.=0A=0AThis incident also triggered a number of life changi=
ng circumstances for me.  And then there was the mysterious "mountain man" =
that stopped and gave me a Mustang Ranch t-shirt to stop the bleeding on my=
 arm.  The fireman that came from the station at the summit said they didn'=
t see the old blue Ford stepside pick up and there weren't any houses aroun=
d there either.  But that's a story for another day.=0A=0ANext time you enc=
ounter a life changing event, whether its a meteorite, a car accident, or s=
omething else, consider the odds.  And consider the ramifications to everyo=
ne involved in the event.  I think you'll find that many of these seminal e=
vents in your life are also surprisingly unlikely.  Food for thought and IM=
O good news as well.=0A=0APeace,=0A=0APeter=0A=0A

Subject: [sfraves] BSP: new dubstep laptop set

corrosion is the result of my experiments with dubstep and abandoning
vinyl altogether for ableton live.  I wanted to see how standard dj
techniques translated as well as how i could push the envelope with
more complex effects and routing at my disposal.  I was most worried
about losing the tactile experience of touching the vinyl - but I'm
pretty happy with the result (I can't wait to try it live.)  Hope you
enjoy.

http://deceptakahn.com/music/corrosion-rc2.mp3

-- 
jason
aka
deceptakahn
http://deceptakahn.com
aim deceptajason

If all mankind minus one, were of one opinion, and only one person  
were of the contrary opinion, mankind would be no more justified in  
silencing that one person, than he, if he had the power, would be  
justified in silencing mankind.



- John Stuart Mill

t thinking about the odds of something like this happening.  =0A=0ABack in =
1991, right before my first son was born, I was driving up Highway 9 to my =
house in the Santa Cruz mountains when a fellow driving the other direction=
 lost control of his van and struck me.  I suffered a broken rib, some nast=
y cuts, and some back injuries that still haunt me until this day.  My car =
was almost pushed over the cliff with one rear wheel fully over the side.  =
The van driver was scared shitless but was uninjured.=0A=0ABut what were th=
e chances? Both cars were traveling 35-40 miles per hour making our relativ=
e velocity in excess of 70 miles per hour.  My car, a Mazda 323, was less t=

of a second  (check the math yourself) would have meant my car wasn't there=
 when he lost control and his van would have plunged over the side .  He pr=
obably would have ended up rolling down several hundred feet of the steep m=
ountain side, where there were several broken remains of cars that had prev=
iously taken that tumble.  My car being precisely where it was when it was,=

ng circumstances for me.  And then there was the mysterious "mountain man" =

t see the old blue Ford stepside pick up and there weren't any houses aroun=
d there either.  =0A=0ANext time you encounter a life changing event, wheth=
er its a meteorite, a car accident, or something else, consider the odds.  =
And consider the ramifications to everyone involved in the event.  I think =
you'll find that many of these seminal events in your life are also surpris=
ingly unlikely.  Food for thought and IMO good news as well.=0A=0APeace,=0A=
